attributes.action: Ask this Government to consider issuing a medal to all serving armed forces.
attributes.background: I consider anyone serving their country for security and safety reasons should be acknowledged by means of a medal of service for their dedication and support to make this a safer and better World for us all to live and work in as a show of appreciation.

attributes.action:
make it mandatory to show on ALL products:
- manufacturer
- origin
attributes.background:
Please make it mandatory for all products sold in the UK to display
- manufacturer name
- country of origin
this should apply to products sold under supermarkets' name as well.
for example 
fridge from electronic shop chain named Sandstorm does not show manufacturer and its country of origin!

attributes.action: Establish extradition treaties so British victims of crime are supported.
attributes.background: I want to raise the issue of the safety of British Nationals and their families overseas and develop on the international extradition treaties and assistance that is in place.
attributes.additional_details: If you or a member of your family has been subjected to a crime a suspected criminal can flee to another country or back to the UK that has no treaty in place and will not face any criminal proceedings.

attributes.action: Ask Mr Trump to conduct his visit virtually and use money saved to support NHS
attributes.background: Her Majesty's Government, in the interest of economy, respectfully request that president Donald Trump, given his preference and aptitude for social media, conduct his visit virtually by electronic means and that the monies saved should be used immediately to support the National Health Service.

attributes.action: Allow 16 year olds to start driving lessons.
attributes.background: Lower the legal age to start driving lessons to 16. This will allow teens to start driving and prepare people to start driving once they are 17. A friend of mine started driving lessons at 17 and only got his license at 23 years of age. The struggle is real.

attributes.action: Introduce knowledge on diversity and the LGBT+ to the primary school curriculum
attributes.background: If children are introduced to diversity and the lgbt+ community from a young age this could prevent racism and homophobia. Hate is taught not inate.
attributes.additional_details: Every single person i have encountered who support discrimination were either taught to do so or were only introduced to it via insults (e.g "that's so gay") however those of us who do not, tend to have been shown that skin colour or sexual orientation does not define a person. teaching young children about these topics and people can help them understand that everyone is different and nobody should never be ashamed of who they are.

attributes.action: Death sentence to offenders who kill and sexually abuse children under 16
attributes.background: Pedophiles should have no chances in doing this again to children once found out should receive the death sentence for the most serious counts of sexual abuse towards children kidnapping and death to children under 16 years of age and for not so serious a life sentence imposed meaning life in jail

attributes.action: Remove religion as a mandatory subject from school and replace with life skills.
attributes.background: At the moment, schools are required to provide religious education. I believe this lesson should be removed and replaced with a requirement to teach life skills.
attributes.additional_details: Whether you believe in religion or not, you have to agree that time is better spent with teachers instructing students on how to do things like first aid, and pay their mortgages. Most lessons are already a waste of time, but let's start with the worst one and replace it with something useful

attributes.action: Ban airlines' seat allocation fees for families
attributes.background: Nowadays marketing is getting mad and air companies are trying to get more monies from people for needless services, where there should a must. Children and families are paying nearly £100 extra to be sure that they will sit together with their children or relatives, husbands, wife on airplanes.
attributes.additional_details:
This fee must be banned for families, as this is extra money on top of the paid charges for holidays, which already cost a lot. 
Air companies are making money from nothing.

attributes.action: Prevent employers making employees pay for company uniforms.
attributes.background: It is unfair that employees should have to pay for uniforms which are mainly intended to provide corporate identity, especially those which display company logos.  Deductions from wages for staff uniforms may render earnings below the minimum wage as a result.

attributes.action: No exemption of neutralisation fee for residents - Equal and fair Treatment
attributes.background:
Everyone should be treated equally and fairly. 
If any nation is exempted everyone should be exempted and refunded accordingly. 
It's the policy of state, cannot be a favour.
attributes.additional_details:
Polish national are asking for exemption of Neturalisation fee which I see very unfair to other UK Residence permit holders.

All residents must be weight in same scale. 
Britain ruled most of works alone and can stand strong on its own feet.
Britain is not dependent on any nation.

attributes.action: Give more advice and provide help for free to the parents of obese children.
attributes.background: Children who are obese have higher risks of heart disease and other illnesses so it would be very important to lower the numbers of kids who are in need of help. Providing more help by making their parents aware of this and sending them free leaflets on how to help their child(ren) would be helpful.
attributes.additional_details: The number of obese children would change dramatically and fall if further support was given to parents or careers of children. Obesity levels in the UK are really high compared to other European countries and the world. Meal plans, guidance and leaflets with facts on obesity should be given to parents or careers so they can help their child lose weight and decrease chances of breathing difficulty, high blood pressure or a stroke in the future.

attributes.action: Nobody should be able to contest a Will.
attributes.background: If someone makes a Will when of sound mind then their wishes should be respected. If Wills can be contested then what is the point in paying a solicitor to write one in the first place?

attributes.action: Review the current deportation system, and address its surrounding concerns.
attributes.background: Review gov. process of deportations, particularly through charter flights; address their impact on detainees. Address the impact of deportation centres, especially on children. Address lack of care for legal proceedings and claims before deportations. Address violence and racism on charter flights.
attributes.additional_details:
People subject to the UK deportation system are in a vulnerbale place, and there are many issues which need to be addressed.

I have written an article with references: http://writingco.tumblr.com/post/157272986629/secretive-night-flights-the-uks-un-reviewed 

Most powerful sources: http://www.medicaljustice.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/state-sponsored-cruelty.pdf & http://www.refugeecouncil.org.uk/what_we_do/childrens_services/working_with_age_disputed_children/children_in_detention

attributes.action: The time has come for a Compulsory test for cyclists.
attributes.background: with the increase of  cycling in the UK in recent years deaths of cyclists on British roads are increasing . There is already a test but its not compulsory , the National Standards for Cycle training test known as Bike -ability.
attributes.additional_details: the death rate on Britain's roads is reducing thankfully, but the exception is with cyclist's.  I have never understood the logic of untrained people using busy roads and risking their lives daily. If a cyclist is a driver then they will have taken the driving test and know the rules of the road, but many are non drivers and are a danger to themselves and others.

attributes.action: Allow Motorcross bikes to ride in public parks or fields
attributes.background: Allow Motorcross bikes to be ridden in fields or parks instead of being chased by police

attributes.action: A deal between Australia and the UK for less restrictive working visas.
attributes.background: As a British Citizen currently living in Australia on a working holiday visa, I believe that the current visa limitations are detrimental for the two nations who would both profit from a more relaxed movement of labour between the the two nations. With Brexit looming this could fill a lost skill gap
attributes.additional_details: Currently obtaining a sponsorship to continue working in Australia is difficult and costly to obtain. Likewise for Australians trying to live and work in the U.K. It's costly and difficult. The commonwealth should be utilised more to benefit the citizens and the countries involved.

attributes.action: Take the National Lottery license away from Camelot.
attributes.background: Camelot is not a British company. The profits go to its owners in Canada. Since taking possession of Camelot they have changed the odds and made it harder to win and invented the useless 'FREE LUCKY DIP' Prize. The whole game needs an overhall with more smaller prizes to keep in interesting.
attributes.additional_details: When the National lottery first started it had a jackpot of £8million every Saturday and even the Wednesday draw generated a £6million prize. Now it is less than 1/2 of this because people have lost interest/faith in the current set up. They doubled the ticket cost and that put even more people off, then reduced the chance of winning even a small prize. Now the only way it generate interest is with roll-overs created because not enough people play to win the prize

attributes.action: Chain restaurants and cafes have to offer blue badge tables for wheelchair users
attributes.background: It should be a legal requirement for large chain restaurants and cafes to have a blue badge table, where wheelchair bound citizens feel as though they can be comfortable and not in the way.
attributes.additional_details:
My mother recently suffered a stroke and is now wheelchair bound. As a strong independent woman, she has lost alot yet loves to enjoy a nice meal or coffee on a day out. However many times we will enter a restaurant or cafe to find that their isn't a spot or enough space. This means a simple journey to a cafe can lead to looking through 3 or 4 different ones. 

In 2017, this should not be an issue, parking is supplied for the less abled, this should be a legal requirement.

attributes.action: Random and unannounced illegal drug testing for all members of parliament.
attributes.background: Random drug testing has become common place within the UK workplace. From the Police to factory workers to warehouse operatives to administration clerks. This same deterrent must be actioned to test the people who hold one of the most important roles in the country whose decisions affect society.

attributes.action: Make Kirkby part of Lancashire again.
attributes.background: Historically Kirkby, a town mentioned as far back as the Domesday Book was part of Lancashire, until being acquired by the Liverpool corporation in 1947. I believe, Kirkby would truly be a prosperous place if it was taken away from Merseyside and returned to its rightful place as part of Lancashire.

attributes.action: Help fix the broken NHS with proper funding from increased NI contributions
attributes.background:
The NHS has funding issues and needs help immediately.
1. I would agree to a small increase in my national insurance contributions to help fix the ailing service
2. NI contributions to be ring fenced for the NHS only
3. An independent governing body to run the NHS and to control these funds

attributes.action: Public sector Pension to transfer to partner without the need to be married.
attributes.background: More and more people choose to live together without feeling the need to marry. However we still have certain pension company's that still refuse to recognise that you exist as a loving and committed couple if you don't marry. This needs to change. Please sign and show your support.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently a high court ruling of a case in Ireland was won by a widower. They had been a couple for 10 years and had recently become engaged. Tragically her fiancé died at 43 years old. She was then told by the pension company that she wouldn't be eligible to claim his pension due to not being married. She then had to fight and with the support of a crowd funding page
successfully won her case.

attributes.action: Tougher sentences for theft of tools from vans and  people that sell them
attributes.background: After having my vehicle broke into twice in the same amount of weeks I think it's about time the government did something to deter these thieves

attributes.action: Introduce a 'Fat Tax' on foods to help beat the obesity crisis.
attributes.background:
Too often in stores youll find unhealthy foods tend to be cheaper, or on offer more often than healthier options. High streets are lined with fast food stores, which deliver cheap & quick option for individuals.
Introducing a fat tax will make healthier options more viable for individuals.

attributes.action: Designate certain careers as a 'Public Service Vocation' with specific benefits.
attributes.background: Doctors, nurses, teachers, the military, social workers and prison officers work, primarily, to provide and care for others and are not driven by financial rewards. This should be recognized by designating certain jobs as a 'Public Service Vocation' with enhanced benefits.
attributes.additional_details: Those who in the caring professions work selflessly in the community in schools, hospitals, prisons and in the armed forces. As they are not working for their own benefit and cannot, in the majority of cases, enhance their own pay packet by working any harder, they deserve special status in the tax system. They also deserve an entitlement to extended breaks in their working lives for rest and professional development so that they do not get 'burnt out' but enjoy long and fruitful careers.

attributes.action: Scrap the NHS.
attributes.background:
The NHS is costing too much money.
People don't need other people's money to pay for their healthcare.
People should have to get private health insurance so they're always covered.
The government should only provide it for those who can't afford insurance or can't get it for any other reason.
attributes.additional_details:
The following is statistical and anecdotal evidence that private healthcare works better than that which is provided by the government.
In the United States (which has private healthcare system), they have three times as many mammograms per person than in Europe.
3.7 million people are currently waiting for healthcare.
In Essex, doctors twice cancelled potentially life-saving surgery for a patient with oesophageal cancer because there were no free beds in the intensive care unit.

attributes.action: Offer a National Savings & Investments Product that pays a 6% interest rate.
attributes.background: 21 Million Savers have again sustained a new blow, following National Savings interest rates recently being cut by up to 0.25 per cent.The Prime Minister, The Rt. Hon. Theresa May, had "pledged" to help those battered by record low interest rates, which have remained at a record low since 2008.
attributes.additional_details: On the one hand the Government maintains that it wants to champion Savers, yet on the other, it continues to cut rates.Savers have been punished time and time again.The Prime Minister has warned that rock bottom rates and quantitative easing had "bad side effects", including "making Savers poorer". She also stated " A change has got to come and we are going to deliver it". So please deliver it.The Government should offer through NS&I, a Savings Product which pays an interest rate of at least 6%.

attributes.action: Provide student loans for British students having to study abroad
attributes.background: Studying abroad is financially challenging, especially with the lack of support from your own country. Foreign students studying in England benefit from a student loan system, but British students studying abroad do not. The government should provide a student loans system for all British students.

attributes.action: Start a new online lottery to fund the National Health Service in the UK
attributes.background: Due to the disastrous state that the National Health Service finds itself in today it is essential that extra funding is found. The Health Lottery only funds local issues, a new National Lottery for this purpose would seem ideal.

attributes.action: Benefits for people who are diagnosed with mental health problems.
attributes.background: People who are diagnosed with life long mental health issues, that affect there quality of life, should not be discriminated, it is hard as it is to find and get support when you are diagnosed with mental health problems.
attributes.additional_details: People with mental health issues should be supported by the goverment, and evaluated to see if they are fit to work. There quality of life is much different, and  the goverment lacks the understanding of mental health conditions. It's is near impossible for somone with Bi-polar, ADHD or autisim to find work and should not be left abandoned by the goverment.

attributes.action: Allow people to invest their Pension Funds in residential property.
attributes.background: Currently people who have SIPPS and SSAS Pension Funds are prohibited from investing in residential property and can only invest in commercial. Allowing residential property purchase would unlock investment in rental housing which would then overtime reduce the cost of rental property.
attributes.additional_details:
It is acknowledged the concerns about pension funds purchasing the homes of scheme members and we therefore accept the need for regulations to prevent this.
However, the unintended consequences of the way that the current regulations are drafted is that the sector is potentially being deprived of significant and stable investment. Investors are instead being driven to potentially more risky buy-to-let investments, or not into housing at all.

attributes.action: Make the Help to Buy 40% allowance available outside London in expensive areas
attributes.background: An interest free loan is available from the government for 5 years on a new build home. This is 40% in London and 20% outside London. Some areas of the UK, for example the South East, have house prices similar to London. In these areas the help should be proportionate.

attributes.action: Re-designate London and the South East's Green Belt as a 'National Park'.
attributes.background: London and the south easts green belt was introduced as a breathing space for Londoners to visit and totals about 580,000 hectares.  Overall the green belt is poorly visited, poorly signposted and visitor provisions, such as disabled access and toilet facilities are  generally non existent.
attributes.additional_details:
The National Parks were introduced to enhance and conserve the natural and cultural heritage of an area and to promote understanding and enjoyment of the special requirements of the park.  There are 10 National Parks in England, which come under the National Parks Authority. These parks are well managed. The parks encourage visitation, improve facilities and work with landowners.

The Green Belt has no such provision, and as such is in reality merely a green blob on the map, which people are aware of, but rarely visit. Access for much of it is limited and not advertised. This is not good enough.  The public should have better access to this countryside and be better encouraged 
to use it. Retitling the green belt would also afford it better protection from developers.

attributes.action: Vote of no confidence in Justine Greening, Secretary of State for Education
attributes.background: Since Justine Greening was appointed as Secretary of State for Education and Minister for Women and Equalities she has neglected to fulfil her responsibilities and to ensure that the DfE obtain all records/evidence in complaints against schools/governing bodies. Currently the DfE does not do this
attributes.additional_details: The Department of Education doesn’t obtain records when parents/students make a complaint against a school/governing body or other authorities if involved. It is vital for complaints where the school/governing body are not providing records/evidence that the DfE must obtain and forward them to the complainant to contribute. Student’s education is put at risk & their records contaminated with misleading information. The DfE complaints system must be overhauled & those responsible held accountable

attributes.action: Allocate funding for researching the possible treatments of Misophonia
attributes.background: Ryan Simpson is just one of many unfortunate people, whom have an abnormality in their nervous system that will cause them to be triggered by certain noises that others don't even hear. I ask the government to allocate funding to research a cure for this dreadful condition.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.itv.com/news/2017-02-03/scientists-discover-why-noisy-eating-can-make-people-angry/

attributes.action: Litter Tax and 100%  of that Tax goes to Picking up that Litter
attributes.background: The tax would support volunteers who litter pick ie transport to litter picking events , refreshments and a Register so volunteers could have a record of their contribution to society which could be used in CV's for example.
attributes.additional_details:
Tax worked out as a percentage of litter, so if  crisps made up 8% of litter they would pay 8% of that tax, then they would pass additional costs onto their customers. Basically those who drop it will pay for it to be cleaned up the company would then look for ways to encourage their customers to dispose of empty packets properly. 
People could put areas forward that need a clean with photos then a simple voting system photos of winning area after and during clean to show the system is working.

attributes.action: Negotiate freedom of movement with Canada after Britain leaves the EU.
attributes.background: Both Great Britain and Canada would be greatly benefited by having freedom of movement.

attributes.action: Lower  the pension  age to 60  for disabled people
attributes.background: Why make the disable  wait for there pension  until there 65/66  they should have a choice  to retire at 60 or wait until they are 65/66

attributes.action: Treat votes as a form of currency and make obtaining votes by deception a crime.
attributes.background: Votes are the currency of democracy. Those who solicit votes through false or misleading claims and actions should face the same legal sanctions as currently exist for monetary fraud. Treating votes as a limited form of currency allows those same laws to be used against dishonest campaigning.
attributes.additional_details: In the world of commerce, when you make deliberately misleading statements or engage in misleading acts designed to persuade people to part with money goods or services you can be taken to court and prosecuted. If votes were classed as a non-transferable, time limited unit of currency, the same body of law and evidential tests that apply to monetary fraud could be applied to politicians and their supporters who use deception and falsehoods when marketing themselves to the electorate.

attributes.action: Lower taxes of pensions for U.K. Armed Forces Officers who served for 20 years
attributes.background: U.K. Armed Forces Officers get paid pensions from the Govenment, however, the government then tax it up to 40%, even though they are risking their lives for the country.

attributes.action: Introduce a higher living wage for zero hours contracts.
attributes.background: Zero hours contracts provide flexibility for employers, and uncertainty and stress for employees.  The living wage for zero hours contracts should be increased by an amount that encourages employers to provide stable employment whilst allowing employers to satisfy their genuinly volatile workloads

attributes.action: Introduce Targeted Sanctions and Travel bans on President Trump and Inner Circle
attributes.background: President Donald Trump is breaching the US constitution, ignoring judicial orders breaking international law and separating families with his executive order revoking visas and has fired the acting Attorney General for refusing to defend an unconstitutional position.
attributes.additional_details:
Targeted sanctions similar to those applied to senior Russian leaders can be used to pressure US leadership to return from the brink of fascism before it is too late. It is important to stand early against tyrants before they can remove democratic checks and balances and the UK needs a democratic USA as ally.

People included in the sanctions should at least include the President, his children, VP, Steven Bannon, the US Cabinet and nominees and the immediate families of all those mentioned.

attributes.action: Have reciprocal laws for countries that do not allow property purchases
attributes.background:
Countries such as Thailand, Mexico, Hong Kong, Malaysia, all have rules that limit what a foreigner can buy or own in the terms of property and land. Yet in the UK, people from these countries can buy land or property with zero problems.
Its time that the UK government passed reciprocal laws.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.macleans.ca/economy/economicanalysis/how-the-rest-of-the-world-limits-foreign-home-buyers/

http://www.theaustralian.com.au/national-affairs/foreign-property-buyers-in-australia-face-sweeping-crackdown/news-story/21794ae0b79f2b46040bc3e5a4a7b0db

http://www.china.org.cn/english/LivinginChina/220516.htm

https://www.justlanded.com/english/Thailand/Thailand-Guide/Property/Legal-restrictions

attributes.action: Speed up A&E times in UK hospitals
attributes.background: A&E's in the UK have long waiting times to see a nurse or a doctor in the hospital (including emergencies). This has put a lot of pressure on NHS staff which has resulted in longer times to wait.
attributes.additional_details:
- Aim is to speed up the waiting times within UK hospitals.
- Put more NHS nurses and doctors back onto wards.

attributes.action: England should be given a referendum on leaving the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: England should be afforded the same democratic rights as Scotland by being offered a referendum on leaving the union.

attributes.action: Urge people to NOT book to go on holiday in the USA until Trump leaves office.
attributes.background: Since Trump wants to exclude certain people based solely on their religion and where they're from, and not because they committed an offence, I think we should show support by choosing not to visit the USA simply to go on holiday. I'd say especially stay away from Trump Hotels.

attributes.action: Make all Utility Companies publicly owned & Running Costs paid by the Tax Payer
attributes.background: I want the government to make all Utility Companies publicly owned as Non Profit Companies & cover all Running Costs by the Tax Payer. This will ensure the disabled, elderly & people out of work can heat their houses & not have to worry about bailiffs coming to their door for non payment of bills.
attributes.additional_details: Losing your job, being elderly or disabled is financially hard enough. Many have to deal with unscrupulous bailiffs for non payment of utility bills, leaving some feeling suicidal. These vulnerable people should not be asked to pay for utility bills that they cannot afford. However, this also means that the government can pay them less benefits as their utility bills are already covered. Plus if utility companies are non profit and publicly owned, everyone's bills will be cheaper to begin with.

attributes.action: A real Home automatically for every Ex Servicemen.
attributes.background: Servicemen are being discharged to find themselves on the streets. Having to live on the streets and beg to survive. They have served their country and our country needs to show respect for them.......
attributes.additional_details: Everyday housing is given to immigrants who have never contributed to our country either through taxes or national insurance. Yet our servicemen are being treated like 2nd class citizens having to sleep on the streets and beg .......

attributes.action: Have all secondary schools in the UK teach students mental health.
attributes.background: I feel this is import as students should know about mental health issues and the symptoms that come with it. This gives students more of an understanding of mental health and shows that it is not something they should be afraid of.
attributes.additional_details:
"Growing number of children self-harming as mental health problems amongst pupils rise, says new survey"- http://www.independent.co.uk/news/education/education-news/growing-number-of-children-self-harming-as-mental-health-problems-amongst-pupils-rise-says-new-a6912906.html

Students need to know they shouldn't be ashamed of having a mental health condition and how to deal with having a condition in the right way.
